item.title: Two master's student defended their thesis
item.description:
Congratulations to Cara and Tunde for defending their master’s thesis, co-supervised with Matthew Purver. 

Cara defended her thesis titled “Evaluation of Knowledge Transfer in GuessWhat!? Game”, she systematically evaluated the knowledge transfer from one task to another in GuessWhat!? Game. 

Tunde in his thesis titled “EDA for hate speech classification study” explores which EDA is useful for the hate speech classification in the unbalanced dataset. 

Both did amazing work based in a short time frame, with everything going on.

item.title: Area Chair for EACL 2021
item.description: I am an Area Chair for EACL 2021: Dialogue and Interactive Systems track.

item.title: Automating News Comment Moderation with Limited Resources: Benchmarking in Croatian and Estonian
One paper accepted in JLCL 2020
item.description: “Automating News Comment Moderation with Limited Resources: Benchmarking in Croatian and Estonian” is accepted in The Journal for Language Technology and Computational Linguistics (JLCL) Special Issue on Offensive Language .

item.title: Outstanding Reviewer EMNLP 2019 !!!
item.description: Ravi was a reviewer EMNLP 2019, and was recognised as outstanding reviewer by the area chair!!!

item.title: Jointly Learning to See, Ask, Decide when to Stop, and then GuessWhat
One paper accepted at CLiC-it 2019
item.description: “Jointly learning to see, ask, decide when to stop, and then GuessWhat” paper is accepted at 23rd Italian Conference on Computational Linguistics (CLiC-it), 2019 .

item.title: The Devil is in the Detail: A Magnifying Glass for the GuessWhich Visual Dialogue Game
One paper accepted at SemDial 2019
item.description: " The Devil is in the Detail: A Magnifying Glass for the GuessWhich Visual Dialogue Game” paper is accepted at 23rd Workshop on the Semantics and Pragmatics of Dialogue (SemDial), 2019.

item.title: Evaluating the Representational Hub of Language and Vision Models
Started Post-Doctoral Research
item.description: Joined as a Post-Doctoral Researcher in the Computational Linguistics Lab at the Queen Mary University of London working with Matthew Purver. I will be working on the EMBEDDIA project.

item.title: Beyond task success: A closer look at jointly learning to see, ask, and GuessWhat
PhD Done !!!
item.description: Defended my PhD thesis titled: “Learning to merge-language and vision: A deep evaluation of the encoder, the role of the two modalities, the role of the training task.”

item.title: One paper accepted at IWCS 2019
item.description: “Evaluating the Representational Hub of Language and Vision Models” paper is accepted at 13th International Conference on Computational Semantics (IWCS), 2019.

item.title: One paper accepted at NAACL 2019
item.description: “Beyond task success: A closer look at jointly learning to see, ask, and GuessWhat” paper is accepted as Long-Oral at 17th Annual Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies (NAACL-HLT), 2019.

item.title: Ask No More: Deciding when to guess in referential visual dialogue
One paper accepted at COLING 2018
item.description: “Ask No More: Deciding when to guess in referential visual dialogue” paper is accepted as Oral at 27th International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING), 2018.

item.title: Vision and Language Integration: Moving beyond Objects
One paper accepted at IWCS 2017
item.description: “Vision and Language Integration: Moving beyond Objects” paper is accepted at 12th International Conference on Computational Semantics (IWCS), 2017.

item.title: FOIL it! Find One mismatch between Image and Language caption
One paper accepted at ACL 2017
item.description: “FOIL it! Find One mismatch between Image and Language caption” paper is accepted as Long-Oral at 55th Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL), 2017.

item.title: Building a Bagpipe with a Bag and a Pipe: Exploring Conceptual Combination in Vision
Document specific sparse coding for word retrieval
Content level access to digital library of india pages
Word image retrieval using bag of visual words

item.description:
Education

  • 2015-2019: Ph.D., Language, Interaction and Computation Laboratory, University of Trento, Trento, Italy
  • 2010-2013: M.S. (by Research), CSE, International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, India
  • 2005-2008: Master of Computer Application, National Institute of Technology Calicut, India
  • 2001-2005: B.Sc.(H) Computer Science , A.R.S.D. College, Delhi University, Delhi, India

Work Experience

  • 2019 - - : Research Associate (Postdoctoral Researcher), Computational Linguistics Lab, QMUL, London, UK
  • 2015-2019: Graduate Research Assistant, Language, Interaction and Computation Laboratory, UniTN, Trento, Italy
  • 2017-2017: Visiting Researcher, Dialogue Modelling Group, UvA, Amsterdam, Netherlands
  • 2013-2014: Research Assistant, Multimedia Signal Processing Lab, UM, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
  • 2010-2013: Graduate Research Assistant. Center for Visual Information Technology, IIIT-H, Hyderabad, India
  • 2008-2010: Associate Software Engineer, Accenture Services Pvt. Limited, Bangalore, India

Mentoring

  • 2019-2020: Babatunde Shofolawe Bakare, Master Thesis, Queen Mary University of London
  • 2019-2020: Cara Evangeline Chandra Mohan, Master Thesis, Queen Mary University of London
  • 2018-2019: Ece Takmaz, Master summer project, University of Amsterdam
  • 2017-2018: Mingjun Duan, Undergraduate summer internship, visiting University of Trento from CMU
  • 2017-2018: Aashish Venkatesh, Master summer project & Thesis, University of Amsterdam
  • 2017-2018: Tim Baumgärtner, Master summer project, University of Amsterdam
  • 2017-2018: Nikos Kondylidis, Master summer project, University of Amsterdam
  • 2016-2017: Yauhen Klimovich, Master internship project , University of Trento

Professional Services

  • Area Chair

    • 2021: EACL (Dialogue and Interactive Systems track).

  • Reviewer and/or Program Committee

    • 2020: Peer J Computer Science(1), AACL-IJCNLP(3), COLING(7), EMNLP(6), NeurIPS(3), ICON(), SemEval-Task3(1), OHARS(RecSys)(2), LANTERN(COLING)(2), RDSM(COLING)()
    • 2019: ACL(5), EMNLP-IJCNLP(5), NeurIPS(5), NoDaLiDa(2), ICON(4), ACM Transactions on Multimedia Computing, Communications, and Applications(1), LANTERN (EMNLP-IJCNLP)(3)

  • Volunteer

    • 2020: ICLR, ICML
    • 2019: SemDial

Awards/Fellowships

  • 2019: Outstanding Reviewer EMNLP
  • 2015-2019: Graduate Research Assistantship, University of Trento
  • 2010-2013: Institute Fellowship, IIIT Hyderabad
  • 2005-2006: Merit Scholarship, NIT Calicut
